previous_headings: “Pretty” Scree with CIs a Tutorial > 1. Preparation and Example Data
title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
text: use bfi data, comes psych package example . data set contains information \(k = 25\) items Big Five personality questionnaire additional \(k = 3\) items sociodemograhpic data \(n = 2800\) participants. details can obtained ?bfi. vignette just use 10 items agreeableness extraversion, sample randomly 300 participants order improve run time. can get first insights data.frame. overview used datscience::format_flextable function apperance table. Table 1 Glimpse First 5 Rows Shortened bfi Data A1 A2 A3 A4 A5 E1 E2 E3 E4 E5 6 4 4 1 6 2 4 3 3 1 1 5 5 4 4 1 2 4 5 4 4 5 5 3 5 1 1 5 6 5 1 5 3 6 6 4 2 2 5 2 2 4 4 4 3 5 5 3 3 3
code: set.seed(42) # necessary for reproducible results data(bfi) # Select only agreeableness and extraversion and sample participants df <- bfi %>%       select(matches("^(E\\d|A\\d)")) %>%    # Regex run down    #   ^ : starts with   #   (|) : Logical or   #   E\\d: E followed by any digit, e.g. E3 matches E\\d   #   A\\d: A followed by any digit, e.g. A5 matches E\\d   sample_n(300)    dim(df) #> [1] 300  10 str(df) #> 'data.frame':    300 obs. of  10 variables: #>  $ A1: int  6 1 4 1 2 3 1 1 2 3 ... #>  $ A2: int  4 5 5 5 4 6 6 6 5 4 ... #>  $ A3: int  4 5 5 3 4 4 6 5 5 3 ... #>  $ A4: int  1 4 3 6 4 6 6 6 6 6 ... #>  $ A5: int  6 4 5 6 3 5 6 5 5 3 ... #>  $ E1: int  2 1 1 4 5 5 1 3 4 5 ... #>  $ E2: int  4 2 1 2 5 2 1 2 2 4 ... #>  $ E3: int  3 4 5 2 3 4 5 1 5 2 ... #>  $ E4: int  3 5 6 5 3 5 6 4 6 3 ... #>  $ E5: int  1 4 5 2 3 5 5 1 5 3 ... class(df) #> [1] "data.frame" df %>%   head(5) %>%   flextable() %>%   datscience::format_flextable(table_caption = c("Table 1",                                                   "Glimpse at the First 5 Rows of Shortened bfi Data"))

title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
text: psych package makes pretty convenient conduct parallel analysis. fa parameter allows specify want run principal component analysis (fa = "pca"), factor analysis (fa = "fa") (fa = ""). want showcase CI observed Eigenvalues method chose “” .
code: # Run a Parallel Analysis (Horn, 1965) with psych pacakge and save the parallel object parallel_analysis <- psych::fa.parallel(df, fa="both") #> Parallel analysis suggests that the number of factors =  3  and the number of components =  2

what: 3. Create Bootstrapped Confidence Intervals for observed Eigenvalues
title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
text: get bootstrapped Eigenvalues just use two functions datscience package. First need create boot object booted_eigenvalues(), additionally supplying method (either pc fa) data.frame. Afterwards extract confidence interval (CI) function getCIs passing boot object.

previous_headings: “Pretty” Scree with CIs a Tutorial > 3. Create Bootstrapped Confidence Intervals for observed Eigenvalues
title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
code: PCA_bootObj <- booted_eigenvalues(df, iterations = 500, fa = "pc") PCA_bootObj  PCA_CIs <- getCIs(PCA_bootObj) PCA_CIs

title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
code: EFA_bootObj <- booted_eigenvalues(df, iterations = 500, fa = "fa") EFA_bootObj  EFA_CIs <- getCIs(EFA_bootObj) EFA_bootObj

previous_headings: “Pretty” Scree with CIs a Tutorial > 4. Plotting
title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
text: output psych::fa.parallel can easily beautified pretty_scree function (exemplarily showcase pretty scree pca).
code: PCA_Plot <- pretty_scree(parallel_analysis,fa="pc") EFA_Plot <- pretty_scree(parallel_analysis,fa="fa")  PCA_Plot

what: 4.2 Adding Confidence Intervals for Observed Eigenvalues
title: Pretty Scree Plot with CIs for Eigenvalues
text: Adding obtained CIs plot also pretty easy function add_ci_2plot(). can either chose display CIs bands (type = "band" error bars type = "errorbars" )
code: EFA_Plot <- add_ci_2plot(EFA_Plot,EFA_CIs,type="band") PCA_Plot <- add_ci_2plot(PCA_Plot,PCA_CIs,type="errorbars")  EFA_Plot PCA_Plot

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Büdenbender B (2022). datscience: Dataanalysis Science Utility Functions. https://github.com/Buedenbender/datscience/, https://buedenbender.github.io/datscience/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {datscience: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions},   author = {Björn Büdenbender},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/Buedenbender/datscience/, https://buedenbender.github.io/datscience/}, }

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: datscience (dataanalysis science) R-package contains useful functions frequently required process preparing data publication. current functions provide additional utility conducting factor analyses principal component analyses. overall goal improve workflow data analysis help formatting challenges frequently encounter. illustrate , present briefly elaborate one typical problem frequently encounter (getting stats R right format MS Word), package provides solve .

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: R provides many opportunities power conduct whatever analyses one can imagine, found often difficulties transfer analysis results R session MS Word. Example Problem: Get nicely formatted (accordance APA 7th publication manual) correlation table directly Word file (*.docx). datscience provides apa_corrTable() function easy solution task. creates path (.e., directories) man/figures/ current working directory R also desired word file (see ). Screenshot “CorrelationTable_iris.docx” Please Note: code formatting inspired adapted blog post Rémi Thériault, correlations marked significance Dominik Vogel’s package
code: datscience::apa_corrTable(   df = iris[1:4], summarystats = c("median", "range"),   filepath = "man/figures/CorrelationTable_iris.docx",   table_caption = c("Table 1", "Correlation and Descriptive Statistics") )

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: can install latest released version datscience easily, directly GitHub : Plesae Note: datscience depends many useful packages, installed process (e.g. dplyr, ggplot2, …).
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Buedenbender/datscience")

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: users might encounter: (System Error 267 @win/processx.c:1040), due special characters username path directories (e.g., ö é). case, can try install datscience remotes package standalone mode fresh R-sessions (packages loaded) (see reference stackoverflow posting). , users might need update packages datscience depends (prominently e.g. stringi). Since R-Version 4.x probably need manually download install Rtools (add path) advance, able successfully update stringi. quick guide RTools given cran website: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/
code: Sys.setenv(R_REMOTES_STANDALONE="true") remotes::install_github("Buedenbender/datscience")

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: functions appreciated , use datscience::format_flextable() datscience::apa_corrTable()

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: datscience::apa_corrTable() function already showcased aboved. function resolves around three useful functions package. Creates correlation table calling datscience::corstars()[1]). Appends desired summary stats flextable. Formatting flextable::flextable() object APA 7th style, utilizing format_flextable() function. illustrate function, use display first 5 rows iris data set. FFIE.png Utilizing datscience::save_flextable() function. savely (.e., prohibiting overwrite files serializing naming) write flextable object Word (.docx) file
code: datscience::corstars(iris[1:4]) #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length #> Sepal.Length                                       #> Sepal.Width     -0.12                              #> Petal.Length     0.87***    -0.43***               #> Petal.Width      0.82***    -0.37***      0.96*** datscience::format_flextable(flextable::flextable(head(iris, 5)),   table_caption = c("Table 2", "Illustrating Functionality of format_flextable()") )

title: Dataanalysis and Science Utility Functions
text: flextable package versatile exactly looking get nicely formatted tables directly R(studio) Word. holds true datscience::format_flextable() function datscience package. just applies repetitive formatting necessary convert flextable “publication ready” APA formatted table. One example flexibility just try print factor loadings prinicipal component analysis (PCA, psych::prinicial) Let’s first create exemplary PCA[1, 2]extract factor loadings: (also conveniently packaged function apa_factorLoadings() function) Formatting loadings APA just one function: FLFF.png
code: # Creation of an Example Prinicipal Component Analysis pacman::p_load(psych, dplyr) pc <- principal(Harman74.cor$cov, 4, rotate = "varimax") pc_loadings <- pc %>%   fa.sort() %>%   .[["loadings"]] %>%   round(3) %>%   unclass() %>%   as.data.frame() %>%   mutate(across(     everything(),     ~ if_else((. < 0.3), "", as.character(.))   )) %>%    bind_cols(Communality = pc$communality,             Uniqueness = pc$uniquenesses,             Complexity = pc$complexity) %>%    mutate(across(where(is.numeric),round, 2)) %>%    tibble::rownames_to_column("items") formatted_loadings <- datscience::format_flextable(flextable::flextable(pc_loadings),                                                    table_caption = c("Table 3","Factor Loadings in Exemplary PCA")) formatted_loadings

title: R Package Citations — Rcitation_appendix
text: Function allows creation full APA-style table citations informations R-packages utilized.  table contain following columns (Packagename | Version | Maintainer | Citation)  function writes two files (given directory) APA style table .docx (default, .csv desired) .bib file correct citations. citation column needs filled manually importing .bib file reference manager choice (e.g., mendeley, endnote, ...) pasting citation respective column Note highly recommend cite main packages used analysis methods / analyses section manuscript. However give full credit packages / package authors, can created table reference appendix. also increases reproduciblity, every dependency run script becomes transparent.

title: R Package Citations — Rcitation_appendix
code: Rcitation_appendix(   outdirectory = "Appendix",   filename = "Appendix - R Packages.docx",   overwrite = FALSE,   table_caption = c("Table A1", "All R-Packages Utilized and Dependencies"),   ... )

title: R Package Citations — Rcitation_appendix
text: outdirectory (Optional) Character vector output directory (two files, .bib .csv). Default "Appendix/" current working directory (see getwd()) filename (Optional) Character vector. Custom name formatted APA-style table, end .docx. docx file provided. NA, csv file table saved. overwrite (Optional) Boolean, default FALSE. overwrite FALSE files already exists, serialized version filename created (.e., appending _001, _002). Utilizes serialNext table_caption Takes character vector. reference see see format_flextable. Recommend following elements Table + number (e.g., "Table 1") description, use APA capital case (e.g., "Sociodemographic Characteristics Total Sample") ... (Optional), Additional arguments can passed format_flextable (e.g., fontsize, font ...)

title: R Package Citations — Rcitation_appendix
text: Creates (respective returns, depending arguments specified) following: Creates directory Appendix/ (outcomedirectory specified) "Appendix/" dir .bib file created citation Either creates APA 7th style table .docx plain .csv table Additionally returns flextable::flextable object APA 7th style table.

what: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
title: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
text: Idea inspired blog post colleague Remi Theriault (see remi-theriault.com) utilized ability flextable able get APA-style formatted table directly R .docx (word). One frequent use case get correlation table word. creation correlation table function uses corstars function package, resolves around code Dominik Vogel. built idea created function creates pretty correlation table together summary stats choice, returns flextable, can easily exported word (see also  save_flextable)Please note: function considers numeric variables (cols). datatypes dropped data.frame df. interaction arguments sig.level nod. sig.level set NA, improves formatting decimals places finale table, removes stars marking significance. However, also prevents table differing number decimal places. Meaning number decimals correlation also determine number decimals summary statistics

title: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
code: apa_corrTable(   df,   summarystats = c("mean", "sd"),   method = c("pearson", "spearman", "polychoric"),   rmDiag = FALSE,   sig.level = 0.05,   nod = c(2, -1),   filepath = NA,   overwrite = FALSE,   ... )

title: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
text: df Data.frame, mandatory argument. Consider filtering passing e.g. dplyr::select() dplyr::filter() summarystats vector summary stats included bottom correlation.  Default c("mean","sd") Options one c("mean","sd","median","range","min","max","skew", "kurtosis","se","missing"). option "missing", adds missings per item additional row (accecpts "missing" "missings", spelling table accordingly). NA given, summarystats added. method Type correlation. Options currently: "pearson", "spearman" "polychoric" rmDiag diagonal corr matrix kept (FALSE) removed (TRUE) sig.level many stars per level significance, options include .05 .01 .001. NA stars indicating significance output. improves formatting decimals table. Note default polychoric NA nod (Optional) Integer Integer Vector. Number Decimals. case -1 simple convention based sample size applied determination number decimal points. See get_number_of_decimals. can also provide Integer vector, want different number decimals correlations summary stats. first integer determines nod correlations, second summary stats. E.g., nod = c(2,-1) give 2 decimals correlations apply convention summary stats. Default nod = c(2,-1).  See get_number_of_decimals ?datscience::get_number_of_decimals filepath (Optional) Path filename APA ready table saved, options include common filetypes .docx (Word), .pptx (Powerpoint), .html (Webpage). Default filepath = NA. NA given, file saved. overwrite (Optional) Boolean, default FALSE. overwrite FALSE files already exists, serialized version filename created (.e., appending _001, _002). Utilizes serialNext ... (Optional), Additional arguments can passed format_flextable (e.g., fontsize, font ...) serialNext

title: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
text: flextable object APA ready correlation table.

title: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
text: Bjoern Buedenbender (Formatting based Remi Theriault, Correlations based Dominik Vogel)

title: Create APA Publication Ready Correlation Table and Export to Word or Powerpoint — apa_corrTable
code: library(datscience) apa_corrTable(mtcars, table_caption = c("Table 2", "Correlations in the mtcars Data Set")) #> a flextable object. #> col_keys: ` `, `mpg`, `cyl`, `disp`, `hp`, `drat`, `wt`, `qsec`, `vs`, `am`, `gear`, `carb`  #> header has 3 row(s)  #> body has 13 row(s)  #> original dataset sample:  #>              mpg       cyl      disp        hp   drat wt qsec vs am gear carb #> 1  mpg     1.00                                                               #> 2  cyl -0.85***      1.00                                                     #> 3 disp -0.85***   0.90***      1.00                                           #> 4   hp -0.78***   0.83***   0.79***      1.00                                 #> 5 drat  0.68***  -0.70***  -0.71***  -0.45**    1.00

what: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
title: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
text: Extracts factor loadings factor analyses (either PCA EFA) conducthed psych package, returns APA 7th formatted table factor loadings additional metrics (Communality, Uniqueness, Complexity). desired table can directly exported Word file (.docx).

title: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
code: apa_factorLoadings(   fa_object,   filepath = NA,   table_caption = c("Table X", "PCA / EFA Factor Loadings"),   overwrite = FALSE,   nod = c(3, 2),   n.obs = NA,   cutoff = 0.3,   orderbyloading = TRUE,   ... )

title: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
text: fa_object Either fa principal, factor loadings extracted filepath (Optional) Path filename APA ready table saved, options include common filetypes .docx (Word), .pptx (Powerpoint), .html (Webpage). Default filepath = NA. NA given, file saved. table_caption Takes character vector. Recommend following elements Table + number (e.g., "Table 3") description, use APA capital case (e.g., "PCA / EFA Factor Loadings") overwrite (Optional) Boolean, default FALSE. overwrite FALSE files already exists, serialized version filename created (.e., appending _001, _002). Utilizes serialNext nod (Optional) Integer Integer Vector. Number Decimals. case -1 simple convention based sample size applied determination number decimal points. See ?datscience::get_number_of_decimals. can also provide Integer vector, want different number decimals correlations summary stats. first integer determines nod factor loadings, second additional stats. E.g., c(2,-1) give 2 decimals factor loadings apply convention Complexity, Uniqueness Communality. Default nod = c(3,2).  See get_number_of_decimals ?datscience::get_number_of_decimals n.obs (Optional), required want apply convention number decimals, calculate factor analysis (PCA, EFA) directly correlation covariance matrix. cutoff (Optional), Integer, determines minimum threshold, values omitted. Default cutoff = 0.3. orderbyloading (Optional), Boolean, default orderbyloading = TRUE. TRUE, items table sorted loading first factor / component (convention). use cases, rather want maintain ordering used conduct analysis (e.g., alphabetical). can archieve providing orderbyloading = FALSE ... (Optional), Additional arguments can passed format_flextable (e.g., fontsize, font ...) serialNext

title: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
text: flextable object APA ready correlation table. filepath provided also creates respective file (e.g., word .docx file)

title: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
text: Bjoern Buedenbender

title: Create an APA Formatted Table of Factor Loadings — apa_factorLoadings
code: datscience::apa_factorLoadings(psych::fa(mtcars, nfactors = 2)) #> Loading required namespace: GPArotation #> Warning: I am sorry, to do these rotations requires the GPArotation package to be installed #> a flextable object. #> col_keys: `Item`, `MR1`, `MR2`, `Communality`, `Uniqueness`, `Complexity`  #> header has 3 row(s)  #> body has 11 row(s)  #> original dataset sample:  #>   Item   MR1   MR2 Communality Uniqueness Complexity #> 1  cyl 0.964              0.94       0.06       1.01 #> 2 disp 0.945              0.90       0.10       1.01 #> 3  mpg                    0.85       0.15       1.00 #> 4   wt 0.877              0.82       0.18       1.13 #> 5   hp 0.843 0.407        0.88       0.12       1.44

title: Booted Eigenvalues — booted_eigenvalues
text: Uses boot  bootstrap Eigenvalues factor analyses.  Eigenvalues can extracted PCA well EFA  Different Factor Methods available details, see fa Allows extraction Eigenvalues based Pearson well polychoric correlation matrices. bootstrapped Eigenvalues can serve foundation construct scree plot confidence intervals around observed eigenvalues.

title: Booted Eigenvalues — booted_eigenvalues
code: booted_eigenvalues(   df,   iterations = 1000,   cor = "pearson",   fa = "pc",   fm = "minres" )

title: Booted Eigenvalues — booted_eigenvalues
text: df data.frame iterations number resamples bootstrap cor either "pearson" "poly" polychoric correlations, defaults "pearson" fa either "pc" prinicipal component "fa" [common] factor analysis, defaults "pc" fm factor method use, irrelevant pca. available factor methods check psych::fa details, defaults minres

title: Booted Eigenvalues — booted_eigenvalues
text: boot object (boot::boot()), contains SE Eigenvalues DF, can passed getCIs  create Confidence Intervals

title: Booted Eigenvalues — booted_eigenvalues
text: Bjoern Buedenbender

what: Creates Boxplots with Significance Makers — boxplot_t_test
title: Creates Boxplots with Significance Makers — boxplot_t_test
text: Code function based Guide . Kassambra datanovia functions creates given vector dependent variables (DV), nicely formatted boxplots facetwrap DVs calculates independent sample T-Test include significance bars

title: Creates Boxplots with Significance Makers — boxplot_t_test
code: boxplot_t_test(df, dependentvars, group, adjust_p = "BH", ylimits = c(0, 150))

title: Creates Boxplots with Significance Makers — boxplot_t_test
text: df data.frame. dependentvars Character vector. group Character vector. adjust_p Character vector.  "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none". See adjust_pvalue details ylimits Numeric vector.

title: Creates Boxplots with Significance Makers — boxplot_t_test
text: List(Plot stats)

title: Creates Boxplots with Significance Makers — boxplot_t_test
code: boxplot_t_test(mtcars, c("mpg", "hp"), group = "am") #> $plot  #>  #> $stats #> # A tibble: 2 × 15 #>   variables .y.   group1 group2    n1    n2 statistic    df       p   p.adj #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <int> <int>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 hp        value 0      1         19    13      1.27  18.7 0.221   0.221   #> 2 mpg       value 0      1         19    13     -3.77  18.3 0.00137 0.00274 #> # … with 5 more variables: p.adj.signif <chr>, y.position <dbl>, #> #   groups <named list>, xmin <dbl>, xmax <dbl> #>

title: Corstars - Correaltions in Console — corstars
text: Creates pretty console correlation table (Dominik Vogel) method : correlation method. "pearson", "spearman" "polychoric" currently supported results displayed directly console. option save html latex format (recommended), transform flextable export directly word. labels_rows labels_cols character vectors labeling rows columns. Reference original code. Additionally added option investigate polychoric correlation clarity able calculate pearson spearman correlation installation Hmisc package required. Run install.packages("Hmisc")

title: Corstars - Correaltions in Console — corstars
code: corstars(   x,   method = c("pearson", "spearman", "polychoric"),   removeTriangle = c("upper", "lower", FALSE),   rmDiag = c(TRUE, FALSE),   rmLastCol = c(TRUE, FALSE),   result = c("none", "html", "latex"),   labels_rows = colnames(x),   labels_cols = labels_rows[1:length(labels_rows)],   sig.level = 0.05,   nod = 2,   caption = c("Correlation"),   filename = "" )

title: Corstars - Correaltions in Console — corstars
text: x matrix containing data method correlation method. "pearson", "spearman" "polychoric" supported removeTriangle remove upper lower triangle, FALSE removing triangle rmDiag one triangle matrix removed, diagonal kept = FALSE; removed = TRUE rmLastCol chose last column can removed, shorten table necessary, default = TRUE result Print result Console ("none"), generate HTML file ("html"), generate latex file ("latex") labels_rows Labels rows (.e., variable names). Length musst number variables labels_cols Labels columns. Length musst number variables - 1 sig.level Significance level (.1 .05). NA provided, stars marking significance printed. helps formatting decimal places. NA especially used apa_corrTable function nod Integer. Number Decimals. Default nod = 2. case -1 simple convention based sample size applied determination number decimal points. See get_number_of_decimals ?datscience::get_number_of_decimals caption Caption table filename File name save output

title: Corstars - Correaltions in Console — corstars
text: Correlation table console file

title: Corstars - Correaltions in Console — corstars
text: Dominik Vogel (Adapted Bjoern Buedenbender)

title: Corstars - Correaltions in Console — corstars
code: if (FALSE) { # Console output corstars(mtcars,   method = "pearson", removeTriangle = "upper", result = "none",   caption = "Correlations",   sig.level = 0.1,   labels_rows = c(     "(1) mpg", "(2) cyl", "(3) disp", "(4) hp",     "(5) drat", "(6) wt", "(7) qsec", "(8) vs",     "(9) am", "(10) gear",     "(11) carb"   ),   labels_cols = 1:10 )  # HTML output corstars(mtcars,   method = "pearson", removeTriangle = "upper", result = "html",   caption = "Correlations", filename = "corr.html",   sig.level = 0.1,   labels_rows = c(     "(1) mpg", "(2) cyl", "(3) disp", "(4) hp",     "(5) drat", "(6) wt", "(7) qsec", "(8) vs",     "(9) am", "(10) gear",     "(11) carb"   ),   labels_cols = 1:10 ) }

what: Format a Flextable in Accordance with APA 7th Standards — format_flextable
title: Format a Flextable in Accordance with APA 7th Standards — format_flextable
text: function takes flextable object, applies APA 7th standard style formatting .  initial idea function stems Remi Theriault's Blog.  Reference APA style tables constitutes can obtained apastyle.apa.org website.

title: Format a Flextable in Accordance with APA 7th Standards — format_flextable
code: format_flextable(   ft,   font = "Times New Roman",   fontsize = 12,   table_caption = c("Table x", "Some Description of the Table"),   table_note = NA,   ... )

title: Format a Flextable in Accordance with APA 7th Standards — format_flextable
text: ft flextable object, formatted accordance APA. Required! font Default "Times New Roman", can changed needs (e.g., "Arial") fontsize Default 12, bigger font size recommended. table_caption Takes character vector. Recommend following elements Table + number (e.g., "Table 1") description, use APA capital case (e.g., "Sociodemographic Characteristics Total Sample") table_note Takes character vector. Default NA (table note). Every value new line, e.g., c("Note. Explanation Abbreviations", "* p < .05. ** p < .01. *** p < .001"). Please note need manually set formatting (.e., setting italic p values). ... (Optional) Additional Parameters, utiliezd function, enables passing passing previous functions

Utilizes serialNext
